name: TheAtlantic
text: "Americans need not agree with the attorney general’s arguments or conclusions, but they must have absolute confidence that he will not try to deceive them," Charles Fried and Edward J. Larson write: https://t.co/JMgilqC8Da

name: TheAtlantic
text: Senator Kamala Harris wants to be Joe Biden's running mate. She just won't say so. @IsaacDovere reports: https://t.co/nkYeMreoo6

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: Even quarantine fatigue feels old now. Whether you live in an area that is reopening or one that is experiencing a new surge of cases, our critics can help. Here’s what to read, listen to, and watch this weekend. https://t.co/IM4UHgO9yM

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In other countries, people are not shooting on eight- or 11-hour-old babies." Afghanistan's doctors are scrambling to treat war wounds in infants, writes @RuchiKumar. https://t.co/9GscUN4nrd

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen: Will people be leaving big cities in droves? @amandamull joins @katlwells and @jameshamblin to discuss. https://t.co/KqzwrGlOC8

name: TheAtlantic
text: Cases are on the rise in twenty-five states. A vaccine is, for now, a distant dream. How do we negotiate the ethical trade-offs in the meantime? https://t.co/kkstX1KT9t

name: TheAtlantic
text: "This is the time to move. This is the time to make change." @JulianCastro talks with @AdamSerwer about police reform, the housing crisis, and his own political future: https://t.co/uTzWTMqnWI

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In other countries, people are not shooting on eight- or 11-hour-old babies." Afghanistan's doctors are scrambling to treat war wounds in infants, writes @RuchiKumar. https://t.co/viZr7kbpTn

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Mail balloting has become the central focus of reformers," @persily and @cstewartiii write. "But Americans will most likely still go to the polls on Election Day, and many of them will go to polling places that are unready to receive them." https://t.co/fDMxZPoG5g

name: TheAtlantic
text: .@JamesFallows looks at the disaster of America's pandemic response, in the form of an NTSB report: “This was a journey straight into a mountainside, with countless missed opportunities to turn away.” https://t.co/COaaRVlpQ5

name: TheAtlantic
text: The emptiness of Trump’s message is an important reason his reelection prospects have soured, @PeterAtlantic writes: https://t.co/jDRKhU5kch

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"What if a single, cheap, easy-to-administer, and race-neutral policy could help close the country’s chasmic racial wealth gap in less than a generation?

Reader, it exists." @AnnieLowrey writes that it's time to try a a baby-bond program: https://t.co/2YUflpiMR3

name: TheAtlantic
text: In a 5-4 vote, the Supreme Court struck down a Louisiana law that would require abortion doctors to have admitting privileges at a nearby hospital. What the case really spoke to, one expert told Emma Green, is "whether the Court is committed to precedent.” https://t.co/vMRdM48z8j

name: TheAtlantic
text: The first coronavirus spike in late April can be blamed on the president’s negligence, @davidfrum writes. The second spike in June is his own doing. https://t.co/i1T8ERo6hq

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Maine: Images of the Pine Tree State - the 25th in a year-long photo series, focusing on each of the 50 states in the United States of America. https://t.co/YO8idzkpqT https://t.co/Dt2LOMnldR

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JamesFallows: What have I been doing for the last while?  This:

https://t.co/VfRorRZ8IG

I think it provides a different perspective on the *preventable* catastrophe of US pandemic non-response, by comparing it with disaster-prevention in another realm. https://t.co/lVAEwEWyVY

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Maybe it’s time to let go of the hurt, angry teenager you used to be, and get to know the compassionate and open-minded adult he’s becoming." @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader who is struggling to navigate his father’s remarriage: https://t.co/HOrG5U8NSZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Supreme Court's decision in June Medical Services v. Russo is "a message that anti-abortion advocates cannot simply expect the Court to reverse abortion rights, just because conservative justices now dominate the bench," @emmaogreen writes: https://t.co/CLVXjpuc64

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @kait_tiffany: r/the_donald went offline forever at 1:04 PM! i wrote a little bit about what this means for Reddit and why it took so long

https://t.co/Gt281SzFS4

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @LoriGottlieb1: "Can you let your father experience happiness at this stage of his life even though he made significant mistakes as a parent during your childhood?"  

This week @theatlantic: navigating adult relationships with our parents 

https://t.co/5XzDtmZn3s

name: TheAtlantic
text: "There cannot be two sets of funding rules—one that sends billions of dollars to local religious congregations and one that denies the same support to secular nonprofits," @mjschwartzman, @RichSchragger, and @NelsonTebbe write: https://t.co/PnPhqh7Kdh

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @shirklesxp: Last night's #BETAwards—its 20th, and the first to be simulcast on CBS—celebrated black culture while reckoning with current events. I spoke to the show's producers about achieving their high-wire, high-stakes tonal balancing act, for @TheAtlantic: https://t.co/KBA4mR864N @BET

name: TheAtlantic
text:
India has banned TikTok and 58 other Chinese apps.

The move will have enormous implications for the many Indians who—as @snigdhapoonam and @PySamarth wrote last fall—use the platform as a path to financial success. https://t.co/cRePoGj8OQ
